column4: i just setup an apache web server, what do i have to look into to setup an ftp for the directories
an ftp daemon
that should work, maybe try 'ubuntu vsftpd' or 'ubuntu cuteftpd'
i downloaded vsftpd and installed, i just dont know if i configured it at all lol
vsftpd has many config options, not as much as apache, seems like you just need to read the man vsftpd.conf page
create the uploads directory and then chown it to www-data
the uploads dir is already www-data
then you may need to chmod 0755 the directory, but that should be the default
the chmod is 0777
did you write this script yourself?
yes, but you might already have it configured properly, did you write the script in question yourself? more then likely you have the path wrong
i did write the script myself, it worked on my old web host
what kind of return value do you get from move_uploaded_files?
its got to be returning false whatever it is
if its returning false, then chances are you need to adjust MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE and MAX_POST_SIZE in php.ini, do a phpinfo() to see what these limits are set as
run phpinfo() it will tell you where the php.ini file is located
says 2m
try uploading a small file then
cant i just change my php.ini to allow bigger file
of course you can, but if you ccan upload a small file right now then your issue is resolved.
right, I don't have a smaller one tho, has to be a certain format
set it to like 512M and dont forget the max_post_size as well, you will need to restart apache for settings to take effect, and then still double check what phpinfo() says
